1.text: The wise woman built her house but the foolish will pull it down with her hands.

2.text: He going in his uprightness will fear Jehovah: and he perverted in his ways, despised him.

3.text: In the month of the foolish one a rod of pride: and the lips of the wise shall watch them.

4.text: In no oxen the stall clean, and much increase in the strength of the ox.

5.text: A witness of faithfulnesses will not lie: and a witness of falsehood will breathe out lies.

6.text: He mocking sought wisdom, and none: and knowledge being easy to him understanding.

7.text: Go from before to the foolish man and thou knewest not the lips of knowledge.

8.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: and the folly of the foolish is deceit.

9.text: The foolish will mock at guilt: and between the upright acceptance.

10.text: The heart will know the bitterness of its soul, and in its joys the stranger shall not mingle.

11.text: The house of the unjust shall be destroyed: and the tent of the upright shall flourish.

12.text: There is a way straight before man, and its latter state the ways of death.

13.text: Also in laughter the heart shall have pain, and its latter state of joy, grief.

14.text: He drawing back the heart shall be filled from his ways: and a good man from above him.

15.text: The simple will believe to every word: and the prudent will understand to his going.

16.text: The wise one feared and departed from evil: and the foolish overflowing, and being confident.

17.text: He reaping anger will do folly: and a man of mischiefs will be hated.

18.text: The simple inherit folly: and the prudent shall be surrounded with knowledge.

19.text: The evil bowed before the good, and the unjust at the gates of the just one.

20.text: Also the poor shall be hated by his neighbor: and many loving the rich one.

21.text: He despising to his neighbor, sins: and he compassionating the poor, he is happy.

22.text: Shall they not go astray, seeking evil? and mercy, and truth to those seeking good.

23.text: In all labor will be profit: and the word of the lips only to want.

24.text: The crown of the wise is their riches: the folly of the foolish, folly.

25.text: A witness of truth delivers souls: and deceit will breathe out lies.

26.text: In the fear of Jehovah the trust of strength, and to his sons a refuge.

27.text: The fear of Jehovah a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

28.text: In a multitude of people the kingâ€™s decoration: and in the cessation of the people the destruction of the prince.

29.text: The slow to anger of much understanding: and the short of spirit exalts folly.

30.text: A heart of healing, the life of the flesh: and jealousy the rottenness of the bones.

31.text: He oppressing the poor reproached him making him: and he honoring him compassionated the needy.

32.text: The unjust one shall be driven away in his evil: and the just one trusted in his death.

33.text: In the heart of him understanding, wisdom shall rest: and in the midst of fools it shall be made known.

34.text: Justice will exalt a nation: and sin a reproach to nations.

35.text: The acceptance of the king to a servant of understanding: and his wrath shall be to him causing shame.
